metadata.title: CVE-2023-39326 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A malicious HTTP sender can use chunk extensions to cause a receiverreading from a request or response body to read many more bytes from thenetwork than are in the body. A malicious HTTP client can further exploitthis to cause a server to automatically read a large amount of data (up toabout 1GiB) when a handler fails to read the entire body of a request.Chunk extensions are a little-used HTTP feature which permit includingadditional metadata in a request or response body sent using the chunkedencoding. The net/http chunked encoding reader discards this metadata. Asender can exploit this by inserting a large metadata segment with eachbyte transferred. The chunk reader now produces an error if the ratio ofreal body to encoded bytes grows too small.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.20 - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04.1
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04.1
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.20 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-1ubuntu0.1~22.04.1').
